required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Performance of Different Daily Disposable Lens Designs in Habitual Soft Contact Lens Wearers
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Performance of Different Daily Disposable Lens Designs in Habitual Soft Contact Lens Wearers

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the study is to refit existing soft lens wearers with two different daily disposable contact lens types, Lens A and Lens B, to determine their performance after one week of wear.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, bilateral eye, double-masked, randomized, 1-week cross-over, daily-wear design involving two different daily disposable lens types. Each lens type will be worn for approximately one week, during which participants record their subjective lens-wear experience.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline - after 2 hours of lens wear
primary_outcome.description: Lens wettability on a 0 to 4 descriptive scale, 0.5 steps (0 - Very poor: Immediately displaying non-wetting areas on the lens surface, immediate drying time, 1 - Poor: Irregular surface appearance, drying time << blink time, 2 - Acceptable: Smooth surface appearance immediately after the blink becoming irregular after a while, drying time ≤ blink time, 3 - Good: Typical soft lens appearance with long drying time, 4 - Excellent: Appearance similar to a healthy cornea with very long drying time)

Lens wettability on a 0 to 4 descriptive scale, 0.5 steps (0 - Very poor: Immediately displaying non-wetting areas on the lens surface, immediate drying time, 1 - Poor: Irregular surface appearance, drying time << blink time, 2 - Acceptable: Smooth surface appearance immediately after the blink becoming irregular after a while, drying time ≤ blink time, 3 - Good: Typical soft lens appearance with long drying time, 4 - Excellent: Appearance similar to a healthy cornea with very long drying time)

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomized to wear test lenses for one week then cross-over to the control lenses for one week.
Subjects will be randomized to wear control lenses for one week then cross-over to the test lenses for one week.

intervention.description: Subjects will be randomized to wear test lenses for one week.
Subjects will be randomized to wear control lenses for one week.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 68 participants were screened, 2 subjects discontinued, and 66 subjects were dispensed with the study lenses.

group.title: Stenfilcon A - (Test Lens) Then Kalifilcon A (Control Lens)
group.description: Subjects were randomized to wear test lenses for one week then cross-over to the control lenses for one week. stenfilcon A - (Test lens) kalifilcon A - (Control lens)

group.title: Kalifilcon A - (Control Lens) Then Stenfilcon A - (Test Lens)
group.description: Subjects were randomized to wear control lenses for one week then cross-over to the test lenses for one week. stenfilcon A - (Test lens) kalifilcon A - (Control Lens)

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: Subjects were randomized to wear test lenses for one week then cross-over to the control lenses for one week. stenfilcon A - (Test lens) kalifilcon A - (Control Lens)

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
